case_title: Mir Nabi Bakhsh Zehri and 36 Others vs Government of Baluchistan Through Chief Secretary and 5 Others
case_number: Writ Petitions Nos. 26, 27, 34 to 42, 54, 55, 60, 64, 65 and 81 of 1975
appellant: Mir Nabi Bakhsh Zehri and 36 Others
respondent: Government of Baluchistan Through Chief Secretary and 5 Others

key_points.regulation_number: Land Reforms (Baluchistan Pat Feeder Canal) Regulation No. 117
key_points.land_status: Declared as State land free from all encumbrances
key_points.land_resumption: Board of Revenue to resume all lands
land_grant_priority: Families of Defence Services members who died in 1971 military operations
Families of Police Force members who died in 1971
key_points.judicial_review_prohibition: Regulation provisions cannot be challenged in court
amendments: Land Reforms (Baluchistan Pat Feeder Canal) Regulation (Amendment) Act VII of 1975
key_points.constitutional_protection: Included in First Schedule of Constitution, immune from challenges under Fundamental Rights

legal_arguments.discrimination_claim: Regulation 117 alleged to be discriminatory compared to Regulation 115
legal_arguments.resolution_by_baluchistan_assembly: Extension of conformity period under Article 8(4)

judgment_summary.main_ruling: Petitions dismissed due to constitutional immunity of Regulation 117
judgment_summary.costs: Each party to bear its own costs
